purpose: Define behavioural guarantees and operational constraints for WyneOS v1.0, including Phase 9 emergent behaviour.

behaviourModel.baseline: System behaviour must remain consistent with sealed manifests and defined phases.
behaviourModel.governanceControl: All behaviour is subject to governance approval and rule enforcement.
behaviourModel.stabilityRequirement: Emergent behaviour must remain within controlled and predictable limits.

guaranteedBehaviours.telemetry: System provides continuous, accurate heartbeat, sync, and integrity data.
guaranteedBehaviours.decisionConsistency: Governance decisions are consistent and repeatable.
guaranteedBehaviours.integrityProtection: The system will reject actions that alter sealed or protected files.
guaranteedBehaviours.predictiveLogic: Predictive behaviour follows established baselines and models.
guaranteedBehaviours.emergentBehaviour: Phase 9 produces higher order behaviour without exceeding stability parameters.

restrictedBehaviours.selfModification: System cannot modify its own sealed files or manifests.
restrictedBehaviours.governanceBypass: System cannot bypass governance rules under any circumstance.
restrictedBehaviours.unsupervisedEmergence: Phase 9 behaviour cannot operate without stability checks.
restrictedBehaviours.runtimeDeviation: Runtime modules cannot exceed defined operational boundaries.

prohibitedBehaviours: Generating actions that violate sealed integrity files.
Producing behaviours that conflict with governance outcomes.
Executing unverified or unauthorised runtime code.

responseToDeviation.detection: Behaviour outside defined limits triggers a governance review.
responseToDeviation.automaticAction: System enters safe mode if integrity or stability is compromised.
responseToDeviation.audit: All deviations logged in the audit chain for review.
responseToDeviation.recovery: Predictive and emergent modules recalibrated when required.

summary.statement: This contract ensures WyneOS behaves predictably, safely, and within governance boundaries at all times.
summary.notes: Behavioural guarantees apply to all 1.x versions unless formally modified.
